intro: Scleranthus annuus subsp. uncinatus, commonly known as the hooked sowthistle, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive wavy margin. It is commonly found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, where it thrives in sunny, open habitats.
